intro: Hacquetia, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically annual or perennial herbs, characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Hacquetia species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. They have hairy leaves and produce small, clustered inflorescences. The plants are adapted to thrive in dry conditions, making them resilient to drought.
